ÙØ­ÙÙØ¯ Ø®Ø§Ù Ø§ÚÚ©Ø²Û |birth_name = |birth_date = 1948 |birth_place = [[Gulistan, Balochistan|Gulistan]] |death_date = |death_place = |body_discovered = |death_cause = |resting_place = |resting_place_coordinates = |residence = Inyatullah Karez, [[Gulistan, Balochistan|Gulistan]] |nationality = |ethnicity = [[Pashtun people|Pashtun]] |citizenship = |other_names = (Mashar) |known_for = [[Politics]], [[activism]], [[nationalism]] |education = [[M.Sc]] |alma_mater = |employer = |occupation = [[Politician]], [[Mechanical Engineer UET Peshawar]] |years_active = 30 years |salary = |networth = |height = |weight = |title = |term = |predecessor = [[Abdul Samad Khan Achakzai]] |successor = |party = [[Pakhtunkhwa Milli Awami Party]] |opponents = |boards = |religion = [[Islam]] |spouse = |partner = |children = 5 |parents = [[Abdul Samad Khan Achakzai]] |relations = |callsign = |awards = |signature = |website = |footnotes = |box_width = }} '''Mahmood Khan Achakzai''' ({{lang-ps|'''ÙØ­ÙÙØ¯ Ø®Ø§Ù Ø§ÚÚ©Ø²Û'''}}) is a [[Pakistani people|Pakistani]] [[Politics of Pakistan|politician]] and chairman of the [[Pakhtunkhwa Milli Awami Party]], an Afghan [[Pashtun people|Pashtun]] nationalist party based in [[the pashtun belt of ]] [[Pakistan]]. The son of [[activism|activist]] [[Abdul Samad Khan Achakzai]], Achakzai remained a member of the [[National Assembly of Pakistan]] three times from his hometown of [[Qilla Abdullah]] and Quetta. He was the only Pashtun nationalist MNA to be elected in the 2002 electoral sweep of the Pashtun belt by the religious [[Muttahida Majlis-e-Amal]] (MMA).[http://jang.com.pk/thenews/dec2008-weekly/nos-21-12-2008/pol1.htm#3 Dissenting Voice] THE NEWS on Sunday.
